2 Timothy__03.1: Know also this, that, in the last days, shall come dangerous times.
2 Timothy__03.2: Men shall be lovers of themselves, covetous, haughty, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, wicked,
2 Timothy__03.3: Without affection, without peace, slanderers, incontinent, unmerciful, without kindness,
2 Timothy__03.4: Traitors, stubborn, puffed up, and lovers of pleasures more than of God:
2 Timothy__03.5: Having an appearance indeed of godliness, but denying the power thereof. Now these avoid.
2 Timothy__03.6: For of these sort are they who creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, who are led away with divers desires:
2 Timothy__03.7: Ever learning, and never attaining to the knowledge of the truth.
2 Timothy__03.8: Now as<u>Jannes and Mambres</u>resisted Moses, so these also resist the truth, men corrupted in mind, reprobate concerning the faith.
2 Timothy__03.9: But they shall proceed no farther; for their folly shall be manifest to all men, as theirs also was.
2 Timothy__03.10: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, patience,
2 Timothy__03.11: Persecutions, afflictions: such as came upon me at Antioch, at Iconium, and at Lystra: what persecutions I endured, and out of them all the Lord delivered me.
2 Timothy__03.12: And all that will live godly in Christ Jesus, shall suffer persecution.
2 Timothy__03.13: But evil men and seducers shall grow worse and worse: erring, and driving into error.
2 Timothy__03.14: But continue thou in those things which thou hast learned, and which have been committed to thee: knowing of whom thou hast learned them;
2 Timothy__03.15: And because from thy infancy thou hast known the holy scriptures, which can instruct thee to salvation, by the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
2 Timothy__03.16: <u>All scripture</u>, inspired of God, is profitable to teach, to reprove, to correct, to instruct in justice,
2 Timothy__03.17: That the man of God may be perfect, furnished to every good work.
